content.description: For <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 16"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>16</mn></math>, the rate at which customers arrive at a restaurant on a given day is modeled by the function <math alttext="R"><mi>R</mi></math>, where <math alttext="R open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>R</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is measured in customers per hour and <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is measured in hours since the restaurant opened. The function <math alttext="R"><mi>R</mi></math> is increasing for <math alttext="0 less than t less than 4"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn></math> and <math alttext="8 less than t less than 12"><mn>8</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>12</mn></math>, and <math alttext="R"><mi>R</mi></math> is decreasing for <math alttext="4 less than t less than 8"><mn>4</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>8</mn></math> and <math alttext="12 less than t less than 16"><mn>12</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>16</mn></math>. The function <math alttext="N"><mi>N</mi></math> models the total number of customers who have arrived at the restaurant since it opened, up to time <math alttext="t"> <mi>t</mi> </math>.
